SourceProxy.label: Extract Region Surface
SourceProxy.name: DataSetRegionSurfaceFilter

Documentation.long_help: Extract a 2D boundary surface using neighbor relations to eliminate internal faces.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Extract Surface filter extracts the polygons forming the outer surface of the input dataset. This filter operates on any type of data and produces polygonal data as output.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Extract Surface filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: PieceInvariant
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is set to 1, internal surfaces along process boundaries will be removed. NOTE: Enabling this option might cause multiple executions of the data source because more information is needed to remove internal surfaces.

IntVectorProperty.name: NonlinearSubdivisionLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the input is an unstructured grid with nonlinear faces, this parameter determines how many times the face is subdivided into linear faces. If 0, the output is the equivalent of its linear counterpart (and the midpoints determining the nonlinear interpolation are discarded). If 1, the nonlinear face is triangulated based on the midpoints. If greater than 1, the triangulated pieces are recursively subdivided to reach the desired subdivision. Setting the value to greater than 1 may cause some point data to not be passed even if no quadratic faces exist. This option has no effect if the input is not an unstructured grid.

StringVectorProperty.name: RegionArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the name of the material array for generating parts.

IntVectorProperty.name: SingleSided
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is set to 1 (the default), surfaces along the boundary are 1 layer thick. Otherwise there is a surface for the material on each side.

StringVectorProperty.name: MaterialPropertiesName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This the name of the input material property field data array

StringVectorProperty.name: MaterialIDsName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This the name of the input and output material id field data array

StringVectorProperty.name: MaterialPIDsName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This the name of the output material ancestry id field data array

StringVectorProperty.name: InterfaceIDsName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This the name of the input and output interface id field data array

SourceProxy.label: Extract Surface
SourceProxy.name: DataSetSurfaceFilter

Documentation.long_help: Extract a 2D boundary surface using neighbor relations to eliminate internal faces.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Extract Surface filter extracts the polygons forming the outer surface of the input dataset. This filter operates on any type of data and produces polygonal data as output.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Extract Surface filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: PieceInvariant
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is set to 1, internal surfaces along process boundaries will be removed. NOTE: Enabling this option might cause multiple executions of the data source because more information is needed to remove internal surfaces.

IntVectorProperty.name: NonlinearSubdivisionLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the input is an unstructured grid with nonlinear faces, this parameter determines how many times the face is subdivided into linear faces. If 0, the output is the equivalent of its linear counterpart (and the midpoints determining the nonlinear interpolation are discarded). If 1, the nonlinear face is triangulated based on the midpoints. If greater than 1, the triangulated pieces are recursively subdivided to reach the desired subdivision. Setting the value to greater than 1 may cause some point data to not be passed even if no quadratic faces exist. This option has no effect if the input is not an unstructured grid.

SourceProxy.label: Image Data To Uniform Grid
SourceProxy.name: ImageDataToUniformGrid

Documentation.long_help: Create a uniform grid from an image data by specified blanking arrays.
Documentation.short_help: Create a uniform grid from an image data.

SourceProxy.Documentation: Create a vtkUniformGrid from a vtkImageData by passing in arrays to be used for point and/or cell blanking. By default, values of 0 in the specified array will result in a point or cell being blanked. Use Reverse to switch this.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify the array to use for blanking.

IntVectorProperty.name: Reverse
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Reverse the array value to whether or not a point or cell is blanked.

SourceProxy.name: RectilinearGridGeometryFilter

Documentation.long_help: Extracts geometry for a rectilinear grid. Output is a polydata dataset.
Documentation.short_help: Extracts geometry for a rectilinear grid.

SourceProxy.Documentation: RectilinearGridGeometryFilter is a filter that extracts geometry from a rectilinear grid. By specifying appropriate i-j-k indices, it is possible to extract a point, a curve, a surface, or a "volume". The volume is actually a (n x m x o) region of points. The extent specification is zero-offset. That is, the first k-plane in a 50x50x50 rectilinear grid is given by (0,49, 0,49, 0,0).

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input to the Rectilinear Grid Geometry filter.
